Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course

Class Activity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Course, Event
    public abstract class Activity
extends java.lang.Object
    Activity class is responsible for managing and storing the information for an Activity object. An Activity object knows its title, meetingDays, startTime, and endTime. Activity is the super/parent class of Course and Event. Therefore, Activity works with the similar data shared by those two courses. Activity handles general error checking and lets Course and Event deal with the more unique requirements for the other classes.
    Author:
    hmreese2

    • Constructor Detail

      • Activity

        public Activity​(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String meetingDays,
                int startTime,
                int endTime)
        Constructs an activity (applicable as either an "event" or "course activity object. Activity knows its title, meeting days, and meeting start and end times. Constructor error checks and sets the values for the appropriate fields.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the activity
        meetingDays - days that the activity meets
        startTime - time that the activity starts
        endTime - time that the activity ends
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any values are invalid

      • setMeetingDaysAndTime

        public void setMeetingDaysAndTime​(java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
        Error checks activity meeting days and times and sets the appropriate value for the respective field. Unique cases for the Activity type (Course or Event) are error checked and handled in their respective class (Course or Event).
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - the days that a activity meets.
        startTime - the time that a activity starts.
        endTime - the time that a activity ends.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Invalid meeting days and times." if days are null, empty, or invalid chars, or if times are invalid

      • getMeetingString

        public java.lang.String getMeetingString()
        Provides course meeting information (days and time) as a string, where the time is displayed as standard time. If meeting day is Arranged then return "Arranged". If meeting day us NOT Arranged then return the meeting days followed by start time (standard), a dash, then end time (standard).
        Returns:
        string representation of the meeting information for a course (where time is in standard time).

      • getShortDisplayArray

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getShortDisplayArray()
        Gets and displays a limited version of the details of an activity as an array. Used to populate rows of course catalog and student schedule.
        Returns:
        1D String array of length 4 containing Course name, section, title, and meeting string

      • getLongDisplayArray

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getLongDisplayArray()
        Gets and displays a full-length version of the details of an activity as an array. Used to display user's final schedule.
        Returns:
        1D String array of length 7 containing Course name, section, title, credits, instructorId, meeting string, empty string (for Course bc it's an Event-exclusive field)

      • isDuplicate

        public abstract boolean isDuplicate​(Activity activity)
        Checks if a Course or Event activity are duplicates of one another or each other.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that is being checked for duplicates
        Returns:
        true if the activity is a duplicate of another activity object, otherwise false.
